10 Jalynn Gregory

Prev school:

Hometown:

Lafayette, Tenn.

Summary

Media

Season

Career

Historical

Summary

Biography

AWARDS

2023-24: CUSA Second-Team All-Conference… CUSA All-Tournament Team… 1x Ann Meyers Drysdale USBWA National Player of the Week… 2x CUSA Player of the Week… CUSA Preseason All-Conference.

2022-23: CUSA Second-Team All-Conference… CUSA Tournament MVP… CUSA All-Tournament Team… CSC Academic All-District.

2021-22: CUSA All-Freshman Team… 2x CUSA Freshman of the Week.

2023-24 (JUNIOR)

• Played and started all 35 games

• Averaged 12.4 points, 3.2 rebounds, 2.8 assists and 1.5 steals per game

• Led CUSA in three-point shooting for the second consecutive season

• Went 94-of-263 from beyond the arc (35.7 percent)

• Led CUSA in free throw percentage, shooting 90.9 percent from the charity stripe

• Scored double figures in 20 games

• Tallied 20+ points in six games, including a season-high 25 points against Tennessee Tech (12/10)

• Connected on four or more three-point field goals in 13 games, including five games with five or more.

• Poured in a team-high 24 points, on 5-of-8 shooting, including 4-of-7 from beyond the arc and 10-of-11 from the charity strip in MTSU’s First Round NCAA Tournament win against Louisville (3/22)

• Posted 18 points in the Blue Raiders’ CUSA Quarterfinal win over UTEP (3/13)

• Scored 18 points on 6-of-8 shooting, including 5-of-7 from beyond the arc against LA Tech (3/9)

• Logged 21 points on 7-of-11 shooting, including five triples against Sam Houston (3/2)

• Tallied 19 points and four steals in MTSU’s win at NM State (2/15)

• Notched a season-high seven rebounds against FIU (2/10)

• Registered 19 points on 4-of-7 shooting and went 8-of-9 from the charity stripe against WKU (2/3)

• Poured in 24 points on a season-high 8-of-12 from beyond the arc against Jax State (1/24)

• Her eight triples against Jax State mark the most made by a player in CUSA this season – men or women

• Logged 14 points and a season-high six assists against Sam Houston (1/13)

• Posted 22 points on 6-of-13 shooting, including five triples in MTSU’s win over Tennessee (12/6)

• Tallied 21 points, including five triples against Princeton (11/12)

• Scored 12 point, going a perfect 10-of-10 from the charity stripe and logged a career-high five steal against Memphis (11/6)

2022-23 (SOPHOMORE)

• Named C-USA Tournament MVP after averaging 17.7 points and connecting for nine 3-pointers, including 5-of-5 vs. WKU in championship game

• Averaged 13.4 points, 4.1 rebounds, 2.1 assists and 1.6 steals per game

• Capped season with 442 points and has 794 for her career

• Shot 38.7 percent from the field, including 33.6 percent from beyond the arc

• Led C-USA with 85 3-pointers and was the only player in the league to average 2.5 treys per game

• One of the nation’s best free-throw shooters, connected for 86.4 percent (89-of-103) from the charity stripe

• Connected for three or more 3-points in 14 games, including career-high seven at Memphis (12/10)

• Poured in double-figures scoring in 22 of 33 games played

• Started all 33 games played and has started all 67 games of collegiate career

• Opened the season with a 20-point performance against Mercer

• Most notable regular-season contest game at WKU with 26 points, hitting 10-of-12 free throws in a win

• Poured in 24 points on the strength of six 3-pointers at North Texas (1/7)

2021-22 (FRESHMAN)

• Started all 34 games played during breakout freshman campaign

• Named to five-person C-USA All-Freshman Team

• 2X C-USA Freshman of the Week (12/6), (12/20)

• Named to NCAA.com Starting Five (12/22)

• 71st nationally for 3-PT FG% (.370) & 61st for 3-PT FGs made (71)

• Sixth in C-USA for 3-point FGs per game (2.1)

• Multiple 3-pointers in 22 games, including five with five or more

• Sixth in C-USA for 3-point FGs per game (2.0)

• Scored in 33 of 34 games, including double figures in 15

• Five-plus rebounds in 11 games, including season high seven caroms three times

• Multiple assists in 14 games, including season high seven at UTSA

• Strong all-around game at VCU with 11 points and six rebounds

• Season highs for points (15), FGs (6), 3-PT FGs (3) & assists (4) at Tenn. Tech

• 12 points vs. Marquette scoring in double figures in back-to-back games for first time in career

• Season-high four steals and tied career high for assists (4) vs. Mercer

• Connected for carer-high five 3-pointers (in six attempts) at Lipscomb

• Season-highs for points (27) & FGs (10) vs. SIU, tying career high for 3s 5)

• Season-high seven assists and tied career high for rebounds (7) at UTSA

• 16 points on 5-of-9 shooting from the field and 5-of-5 from FT line vs. Rice

• Tied season high for 3-pointers with 5 vs. FIU, scoring game-high 23 points

• Best game of season at WKU with career highs for points (30), field goals (11), 3-point field goals (6) and minutes played (45)

• Netted 18 points, knocking down three 3-pointers in C-USA quarterfinals vs. Southern Miss

• 5-of-7 from 3-point range vs. Wofford in WNIT First Round

• Connected on two FTs with seven seconds remaining to force OT in WNIT quarterfinals at Toledo

HIGH SCHOOL

• Four-year letter winner for coach Larry White at Macon County High School

• Highly-decorated player amassed 2,204 career points, 554 rebounds, 363 assists, 281 steals, 334 3-pointers and 58 blocked shots

• Career 85 percent shooter from the free-throw line

• Led Macon County to the 2021 TSSAA Class AA state championship

• Played in the state tournament all four years, reaching the title game twice and the final four all four years

• 2020-21 Miss Basketball Finalist

• 2021 State Tournament MVP

• 3X TSWA All-State Team

• 3X TSSAA State Tournament Team

• 2X Region MVP

• 3X All-District

• Macon County Valedictorian

• Honor Student

• Scholars of Academic Excellence Tennessee Scholar

PERSONAL

• Born April 2

• Daughter of Nathan and Tracy Gregory

• Cousin Kelsey Gregory played basketball at Lipscomb (2013-17)

No stats available for the current season.
